before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"68e9a","text":"Viruses encoding for genetically encoded optical sensors are intracranially injected in the selected area of the brain by stereotaxic surgery. Imaging is performed 3-4 weeks after injections to ensure appropriate expression levels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j5l0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kkd0","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

55767.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4fj34","text":"Set up vibratome","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tuqq","text":"Carefully clean blade with ethanol and water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4b6db","text":"Using a hex wrench, insert blade in blade holder assembly","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et3o8","text":"Run VibroCheck calibration","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcpat","text":"Place buffer tray in ice tray and fill ice tray with ice; load on to vibratome","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d9cq","text":"Superglue a rectangular piece (~2 cm x 1 cm x 1 cm) of 3% agar onto the specimen plate ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29bsn","text":"Make 1X ACSF:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vk99","text":"Prepare 1 L per mouse.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qu7t","text":"   +    +    + in water bath     and bubble continuously with 95% O2 / 5% {"blocks":[{"key":"de21k","text":"Make 1X cutting solution:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52e2m","text":"Prepare 250 mL per mouse","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce26f","text":"   +   +    +   +    ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":14,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bn7um","text":"Chill on ice and bubble with 95% O2 / 5% CO2.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":34,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":43,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tkhq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"225","error":false,"guid":"CC5B230057D811ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"MilliQH2O","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"DC79B94057D811ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"stock 10X cutting solution","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"EA6717A057D811ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"NaHCO3","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.125","error":false,"guid":"02BAD08057D911ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"glucose","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4.3","error":false,"guid":"F8EB85E057D811ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"sucrose","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e4321","text":"Dissect brain and glue it to specimen plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"751h6","text":"Insert plate in buffer tray and fill tray with 1X cutting solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e379b","text":"Lower blade into solution, set front and back limits and settings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9c0n8","text":"Slice at 0.8 mm/s","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvif2","text":"  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aqvvv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"thickness","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error":false,"guid":"D57CDDA057DA11ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"slices","scientificNotation":false,"unit":202,"value":"240"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mqak","text":"Collect relevant slices as they come off the blade, and carefully transfer to warmed slice vial.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"da8mt","text":"This protocol describes the steps to collect genetically encoded optical sensors fluorescence in mouse brain slices using 2-photon microscopy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aetr9","text":"2-photon imaging was performed using a 2-photon laser scanning microscopy system, custom-built on a BX51WI microscope (Olympus). A Ti:Sapphire laser (Chameleon Ultra I; Coherent) was tuned to emit pulsed excitation at 920 nm and scanned using a pair of X-Y galvanometer mirrors (6215, Cambridge Technology). Emitted fluorescence was collected through a water-immersion objective (60X, Olympus), a dichroic mirror (T700LPXXR, Chroma) and filters (ET680sp and ET525/50 m-2P, Chroma), and was detected using a GaAsP photomultiplier tube (PMT, H10770PA-40, Hamamatsu). A current preamplifier (SR570, Stanford Research Systems) was used to convert the output to voltage, which was then digitized by a data acquisition card (PCI-6110, National Instruments).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"cbkre","text":"2-photon laser scanning microscopy system, custom-built on a BX51WI microscope (Olympus).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1af4h","text":"Ti:Sapphire laser (Chameleon Ultra I; Coherent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvhsr","text":"X-Y galvanometer mirrors (6215, Cambridge Technology).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbd3r","text":"Dichroic mirror (T700LPXXR, Chroma).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8rpq","text":"Filters (ET680sp and ET525/50 m-2P, Chroma).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62anq","text":"GaAsP photomultiplier tube (PMT, H10770PA-40, Hamamatsu).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18hml","text":"Current preamplifier (SR570, Stanford Research Systems).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvrbs","text":"Data acquisition card (PCI-6110, National Instruments).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc8c4","text":"Toronado: https://github.com/StrowbridgeLab/Toronado-Laser-Scanning ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":57}],"data":{}},{"key":"7uo7k","text":"Axograph X (Axograph Scientific).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"71393CDE3D2011EE855C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/StrowbridgeLab/Toronado-Laser-Scanning"}}}}

parent_collections.title: Nielsen and Ford (2023) M4-mediated cholinergic transmission is reduced in parkinsonian mice and its restoration alleviates motor deficits and levodopa-induced dyskinesia

{"blocks":[{"key":"asq9f","text":"Pull electrodes (World Precision Instruments) using a puller (Narishige, PC-10).\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8uhb5","text":"Fill electrodes with 1X ACSF using a syringe with filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"er6o5","text":"Transfer brain slice from incubation vial to the recording chamber and secure down the slice using a harp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cakn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"595uk","text":"Locate and focus on the desired region of the brain under IR-DIC using the low power (4x) objective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54oj2","text":"Change the microscope lens to high power (60x) objective and focus on healthy neurons.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fu0um","text":"If using electrical stimulation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7sgke","text":"Position the stimulating electrode on the center of that region. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emiqg","text":"Set a protocol in Axograph with the appropriate stimulation intensity, duration and number of pulses depending on the experimental design. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ku5i","text":"Acquisition modes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j0c4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fcir","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"brip5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m4od","text":"Rasterized image/movie sequence:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kjo1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0i5b","text":"To measure spatial dynamics of fluorescence changes across the whole field of view (FOV), select an appropriate 'Zoom' and then press 'Movie' to acquire rasterized image sequences.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ceoun","text":"In order to evoke changes of fluorescence, electrically stimulate neurotransmitter/neuromodulator (i.e. ACh/DA) release and/or different drugs can be washed on after recording a baseline period. Timing of electrical stimulation is triggered by Axograph software.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f4a4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56ad5","text":"2-photon spot photometry:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"blcb9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"carjk","text":"To measure high-speed changes of fluorescence, select an individual spot (ROI) from rasterized image under appropriate 'Zoom' 'Morph' options. The 2P laser will be scanned across a circular path (diameter: 150 nm) centered at this spot, and emitted fluorescence will be continuously measured.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qb3j","text":"Set and run a protocol in Axograph with a 'Photometry' (TTL) pulse that must be equal to photometry duration on Toronado. PMT output is amplified, filtered and fed directly to A-D board (Digitizer).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6me44","text":"In order to induce stimulatory events, electrical stimulation can be applied and/or different drugs can be washed on after recording a baseline period. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"76c5e","text":"Laser power must be tuned by adjusting attenuation through Pockels cells so that the fluorescence at baseline is bright enough but far from signal saturation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d916k","text":"Turn off IR light source and switch to 2-photon laser scanning mode by sliding mirror to allow 2P laser excitation (wavelength: 920 nm), opening iris to PMTs, and start imaging using Toronado software and Axograph. Turn on PMT and dynode power sources.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53vs2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a5i94","text":"Select a region of good sensor expression based on basal fluorescence using 'Focus' mode (Zoom 2.5) in Toronado.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8rar","text":"Rasterized image/movie sequence for electrically evoked ACh release:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ehk4","text":"Induce ACh release by electrical stimulation (estim: 25 µA, duration: 0.5 ms)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3p4b2","text":"Record three to five movies per region. Wait 1-2 min between stimulations to ensure full recovery.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mib9","text":"Using Fiji (Image J), stack the sequence of images from each recorded movie, average the movies from the same region, and obtain the change in fluorescence (ΔF/F0) in a square region of interest (25 µm x 25 µm). F0 was defined as the average of fluorescence in the images from baseline period.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c37d0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"916oq","text":"Note: For slow pharmacological effects when drugs are bath applied, a time-lapse acquisition is preferred. Individual rasterized images were collected under 'Morph' mode every   Drugs were applied after 5-10 min of baseline.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":176,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ea530","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ba5m","text":"2-photon spot photometry for paired-pulse (PPR) ratio experiments:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cs7r2","text":"Induce ACh release by electrical stimulation (estim: 25 µA, duration: 0.5 ms, interstimulus interval: 100 ms). Analyze the change in fluorescence (ΔF/F0) in Axograph. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pnn6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18o8q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

title: Optical sensors 2-photon imaging
